measure theory

Let D‾\cl{\D}D be the closed unit disc in the complex plane, let {pn}n\set{p_n}_n{pn​}n​ be distinct points in the open disc D\DD and let rn>0r_n > 0rn​>0 be such that the discs Dn={z∣∣z−pn∣≤rn}D_n = \set{z \mid \abs{z - p_n} \leq r_n}Dn​={z∣∣z−pn​∣≤rn​} satisfy

  1. Dn⊆DD_n \subseteq \DDn​⊆D,
  2. Dn∩Dm=∅D_n \cap D_m = \emptysetDn​∩Dm​=∅ if n≠mn \neq mn=m, and
  3. ∑rn<∞\sum r_n < \infty∑rn​<∞.

Prove that X=D‾∖⋃nDnX = \cl{\D} \setminus \bigcup_n D_nX=D∖⋃n​Dn​ has positive area.

Hint: For −1<x<1-1 < x < 1−1<x<1 consider #{n∣Dn∩{Re⁡z=x}≠∅}\#\set{n \mid D_n \cap \set{\Re{z} = x} \neq \emptyset}#{n∣Dn​∩{Rez=x}=∅}.
Solution.

Let f(x)=∑nχπ(Dn)(x)f\p{x} = \sum_n \chi_{\pi\p{D_n}}\p{x}f(x)=∑n​χπ(Dn​)​(x), where π ⁣:C→R\func{\pi}{\C}{\R}π:C→R, z↦Re⁡zz \mapsto \Re{z}z↦Rez. Thus, m(π(Dn))=2rnm\p{\pi\p{D_n}} = 2r_nm(π(Dn​))=2rn​, where mmm denotes the Lebesgue measure, and because each term in the sum is non-negative, the monotone convergence gives us

∫−11f(x) dx=∑n2rn<∞,\int_{-1}^1 f\p{x} \,\diff{x} = \sum_n 2r_n < \infty,∫−11​f(x)dx=n∑​2rn​<∞,

so f(x)<∞f\p{x} < \inftyf(x)<∞ for almost every x∈(−1,1)x \in \p{-1, 1}x∈(−1,1). Fix such an xxx, so that

f(x)=∣{n∣Dn∩{Re⁡z=0}≠∅}∣<∞.f\p{x} = \abs{\set{n \mid D_n \cap \set{\Re{z} = 0} \neq \emptyset}} < \infty.f(x)=∣{n∣Dn​∩{Rez=0}=∅}∣<∞.

Since the DnD_nDn​ are disjoint, we see that Dn∩{Re⁡z=x}D_n \cap \set{\Re{z} = x}Dn​∩{Rez=x} comprises of finitely many closed segments, which cannot be all of D∩{Re⁡z=x}\D \cap \set{\Re{z} = x}D∩{Rez=x}, a non-closed segment. Since D∩{Re⁡z=x}\D \cap \set{\Re{z} = x}D∩{Rez=x} is an open segment, Ex=(D∩{Re⁡z=x})∖⋃nDnE_x = \p{\D \cap \set{\Re{z} = x}} \setminus \bigcup_n D_nEx​=(D∩{Rez=x})∖⋃n​Dn​ contains an open segment, hence of positive one-dimensional Lebesgue measure.

Thus, the function χEx(y)\chi_{E_x}\p{y}χEx​​(y) has positive integral for almost every x∈(−1,1)x \in \p{-1, 1}x∈(−1,1) and so

m(X)=∫D‾χD‾∖⋃nDn(x,y) dA=∫−11∫−1−x21−x2χ(D‾∖⋃nDn)∩{Re⁡z=x}(y) dy dx=∫−11∫−1−x21−x2χEx(y) dy dx>0,\begin{aligned} m\p{X} &= \int_{\cl{\D}} \chi_{\cl{D} \setminus \bigcup_n D_n}\p{x, y} \,\diff{A} \\ &= \int_{-1}^1 \int_{-\sqrt{1-x^2}}^{\sqrt{1-x^2}} \chi_{\p{\cl{\D} \setminus \bigcup_n D_n} \cap \set{\Re{z} = x}}\p{y} \,\diff{y} \,\diff{x} \\ &= \int_{-1}^1 \int_{-\sqrt{1-x^2}}^{\sqrt{1-x^2}} \chi_{E_x}\p{y} \,\diff{y} \,\diff{x} \\ &> 0, \end{aligned}m(X)​=∫D​χD∖⋃n​Dn​​(x,y)dA=∫−11​∫−1−x2​1−x2​​χ(D∖⋃n​Dn​)∩{Rez=x}​(y)dydx=∫−11​∫−1−x2​1−x2​​χEx​​(y)dydx>0,​

as required.
